meanings.definition: Plan or invent (a complex procedure, system, or mechanism)
meanings.sent1: She will devise a new game for us to play.
meanings.sent2: He likes to devise creative solutions to problems.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to devise a secret code for their club.
meanings.sent4: The scientist had to devise a way to measure the temperature accurately.
meanings.sent5: In order to win the competition, she had to devise a winning strategy.

meanings.definition: Leave (property) to someone by the terms of a will
meanings.sent1: My grandfather will devise his antique clock to me.
meanings.sent2: She plans to devise her entire estate to charity.
meanings.sent3: The eccentric millionaire decided to devise his fortune to his pet cat.
meanings.sent4: The wealthy businessman chose to devise his properties to his loyal employees.
meanings.sent5: In his will, he will devise his valuable paintings to the local museum.
